website_summaries.verdict: A quality bed that can withstand your most determined chewer.
pros: The thick PVC frame is stronger than most aluminum frames
Fabric is thick with quality stitching, making it difficult for sharp claws to tear through
Design makes it nearly impossible for pets to damage the frame or fabric by chewing it
Bed is easy to clean, pet hair comes off with just one wipe
Can also be used outdoors, but should not be left out for long periods
cons: Sits at a much higher price point than most

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfy but still tore
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and my German Shepherds love them- and they are destroyers. They go into their crates by choice just because they are comfortable. Very sturdy and well made- had to have my engineer boyfriend assemble for me and he commented on the quality of the product and design! Only giving four stars because after about 4 or 5 months one of them has a hole in the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived it was smaller than expected so I planned to return it. My daughter-in-law wanted it for her smaller dog instead. So I gave it to her. Putting it together was a nightmare. It took three of us to get it to line up and put together. I never could have done it myself. Once it is together it is nice. However the corners never did line up, so even though they are together, they are not flush. In of the screws already worked its way out. The concept is great, but I would prefer to see them put it together then ship it. I would order the larger one only if it was preassembled.
customer_reviews.author: Cathryn Morse

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these! Two labs - 75-85 lbs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these! Two labs - 75-85 lbs. Love this bed. Every pad type bed was taken to the back yard and eviscerated. Cost too much replacing them. This pays for itself in the long run. Tried the Coolaroo ones also. Save yourself time and money, get this one. These are sturdier, currently chew proof, perfect on hard wood floors, and the dogs love them. Typically they sleep on the bath or kitchen tile in summertime. They will sleep on these now. Got the second one recently so the boys had their own.
customer_reviews.author: S. C.

customer_reviews.title: THE DOG BED, money well spent
customer_reviews.text: UNBELIEVABLE!!! I ordered this back at the end of April and held back this review up to now. This IS THE DOG BED to get. Probably could have gotten the large and would have been good for our 90lb dog. We love it, she loves it, and it is still intact!!!! All other beds we have bought in the past would have added up to well over the price of this one bed. Check out the Pitbull attempting to wreck this bed on YouTube or their web site, that is what got us to purchase, and take a chance on this bed. No regrets on this purchase whatsoever. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: James Love

customer_reviews.title: Chew proof ✅ Dig proof ✅
customer_reviews.text: My puppy tore a bed off and I was freaking out look for a chew-proof one, and this one actually works. He also tries to dig it, but of course he can't. The price is a bit high but highly recommend for anyone who has a dog who likes to destroy the bed. It's a bit tough to put together. I have no idea on how to use tool (and I wish they included some tools in bc I have none), but luckily my neighbor is willing to help. We still have a tough time put it together, but finally we did it. Happy that my dog has sth he likes.
customer_reviews.author: Vy Luong

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with instructions, but it was easy enough to assemble. Lasted about 2 months before the pup had it tore apart. Customer service is great, they sent me a stronger material to try out free of charge. When I tried taking it back apart to put the new fabric inside the frame, half of the screw threads were junk and the nuts wouldn't come off. I had to cut the screws to get the thing apart, and now I am without 4 screws. We'll see how the new fabric holds up!
customer_reviews.author: Hound

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. Though your dog may not chew through these or destroy them, there shape will warp soon after your dog lays on the bed. They will bend and drag on the ground making them completely useless. The feet constantly pop off as well. They will now be thrown away. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enough with the stuffing
customer_reviews.text: Finally, I like my dog again. You can pick up stuffing in the garage from $20 dog beds for the next 10 years or you can buy your dog one of these and wonder why you did not know about this before. Your dog will love it, and what is there to chew if there is no reward on the inside? Buy one big enough for a full stretch out which is probably one size larger than you think. Measure your dog’s length lying down and add a few inches to it. Easy enough to assemble but even easier if you watch the YouTube video online. Enough with the stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: Karen F.

customer_reviews.title: When They Say Chewproof, They Mean It !
customer_reviews.text: After completely destroying every dog bed I purchased, this Kuranda chewproof bed was the last resort for my 2 doggies. If this didn't work, they were going to sleep on the floor! I'm happy to report the bed is still chew and tear-free after several months of use!! My Corgi gets very destructive with boredom and has scratched/chewed holes in the drywall in the utility room where the dogs stay while we're out. She hasn't made a dent in this bed! Very happy with this purchase; it put together easily and is also easy to clean. I bought the large size which is perfect for my Corgi and French Bulldog with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: cmc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfy, pretty and the tall legs make it easy to ensure our dog stays "on place"
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble though easiest to do it with two people. Very study, our dogs jump on top and that does no damage. Our trainer recommended this type of bed and our very excitable dog does great staying on it as she was trained to do. We got another one for our our other dog, and one for for in the bedroom. It is nice and easy to clean under them as they are lightweight to flip up and out of the way. We also like that the beds come in several colors. They are easy to hose down too, when our dog has a little excitement accident. Two thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: Picky gal

customer_reviews.title: Buy something less expensive
customer_reviews.text: My dogs don't want anything to do with this bed. They'll get on it if I ask them to and then want right off as soon as I let them. I've even tried it with relatives' dogs, and they aren't interested in it either. It does not easily fit inside of a dog crate with the same dimensions once assembled (you'd have to assemble it inside of the crate). If I had to do over again, I would have purchased a cheaper version or maybe even a children's trampoline. I'm not happy with this at all, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Here a company that truly cares about there customers
customer_reviews.text: We placed a order for a few dog training beds for our nonprofit which train’s service dogs for veterans. After we place our order we where contact buy the company. The recommendation we get a different type of material for the beds. As we use the bed more than the average pet own. They where willing to change the material out for us at know charge. I’m not sure how they figured out what we used the beds for. But we appreciate them taking the time out for us. As a nonprofit we need to watch every penny. Thank you so much for caring. Ranger service dog training.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Cappello

customer_reviews.title: Tough bed for rough dogs
customer_reviews.text: This bed has been going strong with constant use for 6 months. I have Australian Cattle Dogs and they can be hard on everything. They've superficially chewed a tiny place on a corner of the frame, but the cover is undamaged. The cover is less porous than cheaper frame beds, so water doesn't wash right through it during cleaning. I turn the bed over and clean each side and that seems to do the job. This bed is well worth the money instead of going through covers every few months on cheaper beds.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gipson

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Bed
customer_reviews.text: We have two Boxers and they love their Kuranda. We tried Coolaroo before this brand, and there's a world of difference. This bed doesn't wobble and require constant tightening of screws. The mesh is stronger and holds up better, and doesn't sag. Also, it holds both our dogs (they each have one, but often want to occupy the same space). We have two large and one extra large Kuranda; we keep two in front of the fireplace so Molly & Omar have a place to lounge with us, and one in the bedroom (with the Coolaroo) for bedtime.
customer_reviews.author: Foxfyre

customer_reviews.title: OK but not Great
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive for what it is, I kept it and tried it a while , dog would not go on it. Took off the legs and got the pad still didn't like it. It's laying in the barn collecting dust, use the pad in the back of the car. I really don't feel good about the amount of money I spent on this and would not tell anyone else to buy it. I should have returned it but just never got around to it and no longer have the box. A lot of money for some PVC pipe and hard to get the corners to fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M

customer_reviews.title: best product on the market
customer_reviews.text: Every dog bed we ever got was destroyed within a few days while leaving it in their crates. These dog beds are relatively easy to put together and fit in the crates almost perfectly. (make sure to measure the dog crate and order the correct size) We have had them for almost a year and they are still in great shape. We have two fifty plus pound dogs who love to chew. Because there is no room for them to get to the edges in the crate they can't chew on them. The fabric is very durable and the dogs love to use their crates.
customer_reviews.author: pmccaule

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate information was provided on the product.
customer_reviews.text: I received this bed on December 30. I had to wait for my husband to come home from an out of town assignment to assemble the bed. It took us quite a while to assemble this bed. By the third week of February 3 of the 4 legs were broken. The cracks appeared at the feet of the bed where the screws were inserted. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Czmk

customer_reviews.title: Tough!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness we love these!! We have two dogs. One is gentle on things but we had to get her one of these tough cots too so our Bric dog doesn't tear hers up. He thinks everything is about him and everything is his so keeping him off of her cot isn't happening. He scratches at it and we call it Break Dancing as he puts his forehead on the cot and then scratches as he bounces around. Other cots have had holes in them almost immediately. These seem like they may hold up to to his antics. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Landy

customer_reviews.title: Best chew resistant dog bed for indoor/outdoor dogs.
customer_reviews.text: After arriving early YAY! It took me about ten minutes to assemble the bed. The bolts were a little difficult to get through the holes. After introducing my dog to her bed, she laid on it willingly. I love that it can be used both indoors and outside. I have to kennel her when I leave for work and this bed will help her stay cooler and more comfortable until I return. Thank You for providing a great and durable bed.
customer_reviews.author: Russell T. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stand the test
customer_reviews.text: So i have 3 of these beds, all bought at the same time. 2 of them were chewed int he first week. The corners of the pvc pipe have large holes in them. I would say that the metal beds would be the way to go. I don't even know why they sell the plastic piped beds, worthless if you are buying them for a chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Moore

customer_reviews.title: OMG! So happy!
customer_reviews.text: I rescued a puppy over a year ago, and have been buying beds for him every month or so because he always ended up chewing his bed. My boyfriend told me about this brand, and I finally gave in. I thought the price was a bit high, but it is totally worth it!! My boyfriend has had the bed for his dog (a rottweiler) for over two years now, so I know it will last a long time. I just got the bed a few days ago, and my puppy loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Sofia K

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: True -- your dogs won't chew it. I purchased two for my labs because our youngest was chewing up the beds (it was a puppy thing, I'm sure). After awhile there is a dip in the middle. As suggested I tried to dry the material with a drier but was unsuccessful. Both beds now make squeaking noise. My oldest does toss and turn throughout the night so that leads me to believe she may need something a little more comfy. You can find similar products that are less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: LCB

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you need a “spot” for your dogs, you won’t regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It’s absolutely perfect for our doggos! Stain and odor resistant, originally we had a problem where one of the pvc pipes didn’t have holes in it for the screws to put it together, so we contacted the seller who offered to send another, but we decided to make it work by creating our own holes for assembly. It was a minor inconvenience, and it didn’t crack the pipe at all doing this and is still holding up to our 80lb Pitbull plopping down on this when we put him on a down stay.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: So I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: So I love this thing, though the dog I got it for seems to be on the fence. My other two animals like it though! It's easy to put together, although one note: If you have the XL bed like I did, the rail clips have metal in them - don't take that metal out thinking it'll be part of the assembly process later! They are supposed to stay inside the rails to provide support. But good, nice looking bed
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be holding up pretty well. Not sure she digs it though or ...
customer_reviews.text: So far my little destructive devil has not destroyed this yet, which is saying something since I am close to performing an exorcism on her for all the other destruction she has caused (e.g. breaking the metal wires off of her crate, breaking carabiners, jumping a 4 foot gate, ripping the door frame to shreds). In any case, this is her third bed (because we went through several months where I would not subject any beds to her). It seems to be holding up pretty well. Not sure she digs it though or not. At this point, I am just happy to see it survive.
customer_reviews.author: Private User

customer_reviews.title: Quality bed, durable, big breeds might not fit
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bed if you have a heavy chewer. Only thing is kinda small if you have a big dog even at the largest size. It's also very tight when assembled and if your not use to building things you may need some help to keep it from flying apart. It's seamless so unless they really want to chew on resistant plastic all day they just sleep on it. Measure your dog fully stretched out to be sure, but food quality bed.
customer_reviews.author: Plastik loser

customer_reviews.title: Solid, But Hard to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy PVC plastic pipes. But the fabric color is dark brown and not wine color like in the picture. The corners are in 2 pieces and difficult to assemble tightly. It requires a very small hex wrench to tighten the bolts, but wrench is not included. I do not have the right size hex wrench at home, so the corners pieces kind is separated and looks sloppy. Need to go out and buy a wrench to fix. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cheng

customer_reviews.title: He likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our dog who is a big chewer and chewed up every bed we gave him. I like that he has a more comfortable place to sleep, rather than on the floor. It doesn't look like he will be tempted to chew it. He has dug at it a couple times and it has held up. During assembly the last corner was tricky but got it done with two people. Have purchased another for his crate.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D

customer_reviews.title: Like ease of cleaning
customer_reviews.text: We've used this to have an elevated bed off the metal floor of the crate. Our dog chewed up his other bed so this works very well. He hasn't tried to chew it at all. It fits in the crate with a little space on the side and front. I love how easy it is to clean. I was worried about putting it together after the reviews but it came with directions and was fairly simple.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: The Best of all did beds !
customer_reviews.text: This our 4 Th Kuranda Dog Bed .All look like new and used everyday. I ordered this one to put in a roof covered dog area for cold weather . Our inside dog Maggie has decided this one is for her to lay on while television. I may have to move one of the outside beds in for cold weather to covered dog area or order another . Well made and will last unlike the cheaper ones . Well worth the extra cost .
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES

customer_reviews.title: This was the 2nd Kuranda bed that we have purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the 2nd Kuranda bed that we have purchased. This one I had some difficulty in assembling due to some of the pre-drilled holes were not pre-drilled. I was a bit confused when I found that the holes that were supposed to be there weren't and started to call Kuranda for explanation. However, I just pulled out the Milwaukee and a drill bit and it was done. Total assembly time less than 30minutes. Our dog loves his new bed!
customer_reviews.author: GobblerK5

customer_reviews.title: NOT CHEWPROOF
customer_reviews.text: Chewproof NOT. First off it was really hard to put together but the company reached out and preassembled one for me. Then I was so happy took it in my dog area and it lasted about a day before my dog chewed up the legs and whats even more dangerous is they could have ate the end caps and that would have been really bad!!
customer_reviews.author: Lopez

customer_reviews.title: One year later
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this bed! We have a GSP who gets very anxious when his dad goes hunting without him, while he is not in his crate we leave antler chews down for him, but we needed a safe bed for him while he was crated. This worked perfectly. He likes it, it's easy to clean, and it fits in his crate. It was tight to assemble, but it holds him and our ever growing lab puppy, combined weight of 130+ lbs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed, sturdy for my Dachshund , the small fits him perfect. one of the features I love most is the height of the bed puts him at perfect height for me to pet him when I am sitting at my desk. I just set the bed beside my chair and he enjoys laying next to me while I work. I have tried many beds and this one is easy for cleaning off accidents and he enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Leshelle

customer_reviews.title: Chew proof? Not so much.
customer_reviews.text: As a bed, I really like it. However, my Australian Shepherd managed to chew thru the PVC corner in one day (2 down, 2 still whole) - at least it's just the top of the corner, so the bed is still solid. I'm now applying Bitter Apple - we'll see how that works! Edit: Revised rating from 3 to 5 after contacting company for part replacement. And getting metal replacement corners for free! (under warranty) THAT'S how you do customer service!
customer_reviews.author: David Connet

customer_reviews.title: Good product with Great support
customer_reviews.text: our 100lb doberman loves this bed. The original cover lasted 8 months (he runs in his sleep) and when I contacted the seller not only did they honor their warranty they also offered to send a thicker fabric. If this 1 does not last I will buy again just because of how well the seller treated us.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: My Frenchie likes to chew chew chew the things
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!! Fits two Frenchies (26 and 14 pounds) easily. My littlest is going through the terrible nine month chew ALL THE THINGS phase and I’ve spent hundreds on beds. NO MORE. Little stinker’s tried to eat this bad boy while I watch gleefully and cackle. Assembly was uh... not fun, but could’ve been worse. Worth it in the long run though. It’s pretty stylish and the dogs seem to like it. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Andersen

customer_reviews.title: She uses it every day for 5 months and it is still in great shape. Can't say how it holds up to ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a new sofa and did not want the dog on it, so we got this to be an alternative. My dog is a rather solid(ie FAT) bulldog that weighs around 75 pounds. She uses it every day for 5 months and it is still in great shape. Can't say how it holds up to chewing since she has not attempted that yet. I would highly recommend a cover of some sort. The fabric, while very strong, is very loud when she moves around on it or gets on gets off.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hart

customer_reviews.title: Order the next size up for comfort for your dog.
customer_reviews.text: My Collies love these although I would recommend getting the xxl not the xl. My male dogs are over 85 lbs but barely fit length wise one these beds. I'm going to keep them because they were kind of a pain in the butt to put together and they do like them, These beds are a perfect fit for my females, I'll know for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L Szymanski-Mataya

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this bed!
customer_reviews.text: My English Bulldog won't get off of this bed! Our dog trainer recommended this product, and we are very happy with it. My 7 month dog was house trained using a kennel. We now use the Kuranda bed instead of the kennel. The dog seems happier and better rested using this bed. It was easy to install, although it didn't come with any instructions. I found a video on youtube, and put it together in about 5 minutes. This bed is lightweight and easy to transport from room to room. I recommend that you also buy a fleece cover for the bed. Kuranda makes several options sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pange

customer_reviews.title: Finally...A Bed My Puppy Can't Destroy
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is the most destructive puppy I've ever had. We're doing everything to help her through this phase, and THIS BED is part of that effort. There's not a scratch or chew mark on it. Maybe she's tried or maybe it just doesn't look appetizing. All I know is that it is still standing three months later. If you have an aggressive chewer, just click buy.
customer_reviews.author: Watch Tower 500

customer_reviews.title: This is great for our 65-lb lab/pit mix
customer_reviews.text: This is great for our 65-lb lab/pit mix. I was worried perhaps I'd gotten it too big, but it is perfect because he likes to stretch all the way out, and this size accommodates that. And room for some toys. It looks good in the living room too. I was also worried it might be too tall, but it is not, it's a perfect height as well. It's really sturdy and our dog can play rough and has strong nails, but I dont think he'll ever get through that ballistic fabric. It does make noise when he moves about on it. I'm really happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Karra Bikson

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bed!
customer_reviews.text: Great dog bed, fits perfectly in our dog's kennel. Our 4 month old Golden retriever loves it. If your dog happens to have accidents in the kennel on top of this bed simply remove the bed and wash the canvas material with something like nature's miracle or even dawn dish detergent. then let it stand up to dry in a bath tub for a couple of hours, turning it once or twice to release any water captured in the channels holding the canvas in.
customer_reviews.author: Davey from the Navy (retired)

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and the dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: My aging 60 lb dog loves this bed. It's low enough he doesn't have to struggle to get on/off it yet suspends him off the floor and supports him (apparently) comfortably. It quickly became his go-to spot in the living room. Easy enough to assemble and quite durable. So far, my pit bull hasn't tried to destroy it or, if she has, hasn't had any success.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Grim

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for better
customer_reviews.text: Putting this together is fairly straightforward but it takes a little tinkering to click the final corners in place. Terrific for training to "Go to your place". Once trained to stay on it, our dog can be with us in the family room without a leash.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Like the old beds better.
customer_reviews.text: I like the old beds better for rescue.. I ordered $1000 worth of new beds for our boarding facility the cloth is durable (so far) but prefer the plastic beds as at least they stay dry after cleaning them. Still the most durable beds. Putting them together is a pain and still missing the legs for 4 of the beds
customer_reviews.author: karen Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Nearly indestructible and comfy for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product. I can’t tell you how many dog beds my two 11-month-old labradoodles have destroyed $$$ I ordered one of these beds several months ago and it’s holding up great! The dogs use and enjoy it so I just got a second one. They’re comfy, dang near indestructible, and I found that the different sizes nest/tuck neatly under each other for easier storage.
customer_reviews.author: amazon lover

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Had some problems with hardware not being threaded all the way through. Had to drill it out and replace hardware. Not that well made in that sense but good for price and serves purpose. Our thick haired puppy likes cooler place to sleep sometimes and this breathes. She also thinks it’s fun to crawl under.
customer_reviews.author: NativeCO

customer_reviews.title: Comfort for my older dogs!
customer_reviews.text: These beds don't sweat on my floor like everything else has been doing. My big dogs are 13 years old and they love these beds! I think they are pretending to be deaf so they don't have to get up in the mornings!! They were unsure about them at first but with the covers on, they love them! My dogs are 80, 60, and 55 pounds and I wish I had bought the XXL first as any 2 of them can fit on it comfortably and then I would only have 2 beds instead of 3, but I know they will last and the dogs love them so it was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: N. Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a half dogo Argentino / half scrap metal shredder
customer_reviews.text: I have a Creature that’s half dogo Argentino/half scrap metal shredder. Your item was put to the test. Did she eat your product up? Yes... but you replaced my dog bed for a stronger one. Thank you. She’s in the process of chewing the stronger dog bed to peaces, and I have Faith that she’ll destroy that one too... but i also have faith that you’ll take care of us again. ❤️ Great product! Don’t feel bad, she ate through a steel chain just last week❗️
customer_reviews.author: Kim and Jerry

customer_reviews.title: This one is worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dog bed I have EVER bought. The cheaper ones have not held up at all. These beds are relatively expensive compared to others of similar design, but they do hold up. I would buy it again, and I plan to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Sueann Petrea

customer_reviews.title: Great but Need longer screws for lock washers
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for my very large poodle. However the screws were way too short to use the lock washers. So it’s a pain in the neck to constantly tighten the bolts. Also the holes pre-drilled for the corner pieces didn’t line up as a perfect match top & bottom. Some holes were drilled at an angle making it almost impossible to put the bed together by my self. I recommend this bed, my 8 mos. isn’t a chewer, even so it’s very sturdy. You likely want to go buy your own screws that are longer so you can use the lock washers.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Brotten

customer_reviews.title: Best bed if your have a chewer! Seems Indestructible!
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed up his last nice plush bed...so I bought this one! It’s super sturdy, high quality and I don’t see any way possible for my dog to ruin this. Perfect for indoors and outdoors. Looks great. My dog sleeps on his back and really looks comfortable on this. I throw a little blanket over him and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Clark

customer_reviews.title: Item is nearly a full size smaller than listed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a large which is listed as 40x25. This was already pushing it a little for my dog. The bed that arrived was 37x23. Far too small for him. The tag says it's a large. So it's just a major manufacturing issue. This is nearly as small as their medium!
customer_reviews.author: Eliyahu E.

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised! Super durable and looks great. Not very easy to assemble (took 2 people and tools not included) because it’s under tension to have the pieces all line up. I work at a professional boarding facility and we use the aluminum ones. They aren’t completely indestructible, a very dedicated chewer can scratch the frame with teeth and the legs just pop in (so can be popped out if a dog is persistent). If they get pooped or peed on, they clean pretty easily in the tub with a scrub brush and soap. Overall, a great bed that will last most dogs a lifetime
customer_reviews.author: Kelly.

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This was rather cumbersome to put together, although you wouldn’t think so by looking at it. Anytime you get something with pre-drilled screw holes to line up, seems to be an issue. My dogs did not care for this at all : ( Tried treats on the bed and nothing doing.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and our dog loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had chewed up every dog bed and crate pad we gave him. He wasn’t completely comfortable on the cot-like bed at first but we purchased the pad to go with it and he loves it! It is very sturdy, easily wipes clean, and the pad can be washed. So far this has been a great investment for our 4-legged friend!
customer_reviews.author: SLane

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy dog bed. It was very difficult to put together but we did succeed. It is much smaller than we anticipated. We have a mix breed lab and it is too small for her we purchased the large size. We also have a medium size terrier mix and it is more her size. Neither dog will have anything to do with it. Keeping it until spring to see if they will use it on the deck. If not it will be donated to our local shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen J.

customer_reviews.title: Kuranda beds are well made, and customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the product outstanding, so is the company. When I ordered, I was ordering for our Humane Society. I was immediately notified that a more durable covering was available for this use, and the correction was made. I so appreciated this.
customer_reviews.author: JCB

customer_reviews.title: Good durable bed for the money
customer_reviews.text: My beagles destroyed every bed I bought until this one. It took them a minute to figure out it's a bed, but now they love it. I didn't expect it to come in so many pieces and it was a little tricky putting together, but it's a good option for bed chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Dane approved!!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect bed for Great Danes! We have 2 Danes & 2 of these beds! After 1.5 years of constant use, these beds look brand new! Our 3 yr old grandson loves to jump on these beds when he gets excited. Still, these beds are in perfect shape! Not the cheapest of the raised beds. but, worth every penny!! Thanks for great quality & happy Danes!!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi In Ohio

customer_reviews.title: You can put this over a crate  with some work
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought it was to put it into a 30" x 19" dog crate. It did not fit into the crate but what I did was remove the bottom of the crate, then drill holes into the side bars for zip ties, then zip tie the crate to the dog bed. It was worked AWESOME! My horrible Corgi Donvan - who chews up everything, including the baseboards and the deck - cannot harm this dog bed!
customer_reviews.author: althereviewer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: This bed has been the perfect solution after our rambunctious puppy chewed up his previous three plush and expensive beds. It fits in his crate and when he peed on it, it held all the liquid on top and was easy to spray down and clean. Putting it together takes some patience (and a helper) but now he is no longer sleeping on hard plastic base of his crate! Can't say enough good things about this bed, the price is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Urbani

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few months before reviewing this product because I wanted to see if this could hold up against our very aggressive chewer, and it has! We've bought many of the other expensive "chew proof" beds and our 1 year old Labrador has chewed through them all. This is the only bed that has worked for her and she really loves it. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog didn't like
customer_reviews.text: I Liked the bed more than my German Shepherd. She seems a little on the big side for the bed. This may of been a product that I needed to try in a brick & mortar store. Descriptions can be difficult to fit with animal. That being said, the bed looks good and if my dog would use it, it would of been a great item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Riot Approved!
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 5 paws for Riot! This is our second bed and it’s fairly indestructible despite the digging and chewing and weather when outside. Only took one paw off for difficulty of assembly. Definitely a 2 person job and doesn’t click nicely together. First package did not have instructions. Once assembled, great product! We ordered the large but it was too small for all 90 pounds of him, so if you’ve got a bigger good boy, XL is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: CSP R09

customer_reviews.title: At least this one hasn't been chewed apart within 48 hrs by a 13 lb puppy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is wonderful, my baby princess jack Russell has torn up, scratched or down right destroyed anything that we've bought her, usually within 72 hrs. but NOT this bed.. and the price was right.. I have 6 more to buy. the assemble was easy until the last corner, then you need some strong hands to push/hold to get the screws thru the hole on the top piece.. it would be nice though if you had longer screws.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is light and easy to clean under. It doesn't mar the floors or walls. I bought the pad that attaches to it and the dogs love it! The pad is machine washable and easy to care for which is exactly what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Facelikeaflint

customer_reviews.title: Great beds
customer_reviews.text: Both of my dogs love these beds. I bought 2 large beds and the cushion for each. They seem very durable and they are lightweight. I can't say if they are chew proof or not. My dogs have not tried to.
customer_reviews.author: K. Spada

customer_reviews.title: "XL" bed not for XL breeds
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: bed is smaller than advertised! Actual dimensions for XL bed measure 40x24, not 44x27. Probably will only work for medium sized breeds. Otherwise appears to be well made, will try their largest size Update: customer service was excellent! They understood the problem and accepted my return. My new XXL karunda arrived within a few days and my GSD/mal loves to stretch out on it. I would also recommend the fleece cover. If your large dog likes to sleep stretched out, the XXL is the size you need.
customer_reviews.author: DonM

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!!!! CHEW PROOF BED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have gone through at least five dog beds and our dog has destroyed all. This bed was easy to assemble, comfortable, and dog cant get an edge so he's actually never even tried to chew it. Prayers answered. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Coral Cay Kid

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy from this company
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this dog bed for 5 months and now the middle is sagging and 1 leg is broken (it’s hard to see what I’m talking about in the pictures) this company offers a 1 year warranty but when you try to call them on it they ignore your emails even though I complied with their request for pictures.... DON’T BUY THIS DOG BED!!
customer_reviews.author: monicaromero3

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Well built and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My puppy hates laying on the floor and only wanted the couch. This is a nice alternative. He didn’t take to it at first but now he’s really comfortable on it as long as we also put a soft blanket on top. It was more difficult to assemble than I thought it would be but the product is really solid. It holds up to any chewing or scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Brad D.

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bed!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these beds, which are definitely chewproof. I ordered these beds after the dogs destroyed the third regular dog bed. Then I remembered these beds from the shelter where we got our first dog. We purchased two larges, one for each of our dogs, a 75 lb Chesapeake Bay Retriever and a 50 lb Redbone Coonhound. The size large is almost too small for the Chessie, but he seems comfortable enough. It's been about a month and they are holding up just fine. I'd definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda N.

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bed
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these beds. They are designed to be so sturdy and secure, that they can be a challenge to assemble. The best part is, your dog can not chew on the cot material so they’ll last a long, long time. As you can see in my pic, a screw came out in our indoor bed, but I believe that was user error. Even with the missing screw, it’s in perfect condition. So is the one we keep outside.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Really important to have for training your dog with stay and waiting. Really easy to put together and light weight. Easy to store and put away as well. I was recommended to buy this from our dog trainer
customer_reviews.author: Marz Léon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My dog has had this bed for a few months now. She has chewed through everything regarding bedding. This is the first thing that has lasted. My only regret is not buying it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd bed two sizes for 2 different dog sizes!! They are awesome, they hold up great both inside and outside! I highly recommend this product well worth the Money!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbie Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: I lost track of how many beds I’ve bought my dogs in the past. A waste of money. I should have bought these beds a long time ago. They are very well made and will last a very long time. From what I see my dogs look happy and comfortable with their beds. They’re easy to clean too! Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality bed.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. My rescue dog loved this immediately... until he discovered he was allowed on the couch. I assembled this myself and it did not take long. It does not fit in the crate. I also ordered the bed cover, which is soft and fits the bed perfectly. I washed it once and it required no special treatment.
customer_reviews.author: AGox

customer_reviews.title: This a good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This a good product for the price. If you have a older dog with bladder problems this great the urine won't leak trough to the floor and ruin the hardwoods. You can clean the bed really easy and it drys off pretty fast. I had a 85 lbs American Bull dog that was 14 years old who loved to sleep on it. I would definitely recommend it for people with older dogs got want to give them a good place to sleep
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly Chew Proof!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these beds and 2 from another chew proof company. These are the only ones still standing. No damage after over a year of use. They are well used and loved by my dogs and the only bed I will ever recommend for a destructive dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: These beds are very sturdy. We have two Great Danes that would tear up every bed that was bought for them until we bought the Kuranda bed. This bed is amazing! Both dogs are 140 pounds each and when they're not napping on it, they're playing with each other using the bed as a trampoline. They absolutely love this bed!!! I highly recommend this bed especially if you have a dog that likes to chew and destroy everything in sight. This bed is very strong and holds up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: great, tough bed, malinois tested
customer_reviews.text: We have belgian malinois who is a bad chewer that destroyed another bed in her outdoor kennel before this one in the very short time she is actually out there! We have had this for a few months and its just a matter of hosing it off every once and awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Littleford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bed for my Dog!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this bed. At first she wouldn't use it, but, after 4 days of that, I made a fleece blanket for the top, with elastic, and that did the trick. Now she can be spotted lounging on her bed, elk antler bone from Doggie Dealz close by, at any time of the day! So pleased with this purchase - it's PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lachelt

customer_reviews.title: Durable & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The 1st bed we got him lasted about 2 months. After repeated pouncing, the cot broke. I have 2 of these for my 70 lb dog. The 1st is over a year old. One is indoor with the pillow & the other one is for outside. My dog loves hanging out on it & people watching.
customer_reviews.author: Kati

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bed, but it's by far the hardest thing I've ever had to assemble. Note that compared to the Coolaroo, the fabric is waterproof, kind of rubbery.
customer_reviews.author: PatC

customer_reviews.title: Small for a Large Bed
customer_reviews.text: This bed is sturdy but it's a lot smaller then I thought it was going to be for a large bed. It works for my 75lb bulldog... but just barely. Just an average rating for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well in heavy rescue use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these in XL for a Doberman Rescue. The rescue loves them, and, more importantly, says the dogs love them. I purchased two more in the XXL size for the really big Dobies the rescue sometimes gets, but for normal size Dobies, the XL was the right size. The rescue gets a lot of Dobermans in and adopts a lot out, so I was worried about the durability of the beds, but all reports are that after a month of constant use, the beds are holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Our Dog Loves This Bed!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews .... but I couldn't resist showing this video .... Indestructible is a very strong word, but if you watch the video, it's hard to find another word to describe the durability of this dog bed. The bed is in my dog's run .... he's had it for about 5 months now .... it's outlasted all other beds our dog has ever had! And oh by the way, he enjoys laying on it as well as playing with it!
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME bed, very durable.
customer_reviews.text: We have bought many beds, all to be chewed up by our loving pups. This one is durable, and made so that there are no areas where the inquisitive dogs can get their teeth into. The only thing they could get was the tag. We even had purchased a Kong bed, supposedly indestructable, and they chewed through it several places, and FLUFF everywhere. This bed is easy to clean, hoses off easily and holds both dogs with a combined weight of about 70 lbs. Thank you, Kuranda, for finally having us find a bed that our dogs will use for longer than a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Diva Reader

customer_reviews.title: She is content and comfortable once again and I'm happy know she's not injesting ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1 year old lab mix that chews everything to pieces. Has eaten 2 beds already. This works amazingly! I put it right inside her kennel and have been using daily/nightly for 3 months without so much as a scratch to it. She is content and comfortable once again and I'm happy know she's not injesting bedding material. Highly recommend for chewers.
customer_reviews.author: farmmom

customer_reviews.title: Just buy one, you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: absolutely the best most durable dog bed I’ve ever seen or have had. You won’t be disappointed, just make sure you get one big enough for your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Terpstra

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this bed for my dog, an 80 lb pit bull. It was delivered in a timely manner and I was able to put it together myself (it was slightly challenging but manageable). The bed gets 5 stars for the durability factor. My dog is not a chewer so this bed could potentially last a very long time. Unfortunately, though, to my bewilderment my dog has absolutely no interest in sleeping on this bed. She prefers her dirty, ratty blanket on the cold floor. I'm going to keep the bed for my next dog, though.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Strong bed
customer_reviews.text: Nice bed 90lb gsd. Likes it. Only problem was it was missing 8 screws and nuts to put it together. Customer service offered to send them but I asked for sizes and went to home depot and other up. Very satisfied with the bed
customer_reviews.author: Paul_bellissimo

customer_reviews.title: Not chew proof
customer_reviews.text: I have one that my pit absolutely loves. However, I got one for my shepherd and he was easily able to rip it up. Really a shame since I love the idea. So much for chew proof  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄
customer_reviews.author: Runawayturtle21

customer_reviews.title: After seeing such great reviews I had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: After seeing such great reviews I had high hopes, but not impressed with the quality of the product. Putting it together was a pain, and after two weeks, the frame started to bend. The bed is still together, which is great, but its bowed inwards, and isn't something that can be fixed. For the cost of the bed I expected it to hold up longer than that
customer_reviews.author: Areo

customer_reviews.title: A big hit!
customer_reviews.text: It took a week for my pups to really get comfy on this bed, but once they did, forget about it! Now I have four of them vying for position, and will definitely have to order another one. Unlike other reviewers whose dogs will share, my four big brutes each want to be king of the hill on this one. A wonderful product and guess what --- my cats like to sleep under it, it's a perfect little hideaway den for them!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Cross

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, they haven't figured out how to flip or ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for our dogs to test out. It has lasted for a while; however, our youngest dog was able to chew the corners and leave marks, as well as scratch the fabric & leave marks, but it still works. The legs tend to slip out when you move the bed around. Fortunately, they haven't figured out how to flip or grab the bed with their teeth. They both enjoy lounging on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sal & Letty

customer_reviews.title: Animal Shelter
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the local animal shelter. They've withstood the ultimate test of several hundred dogs coming in and then going out into forever homes. Very sturdy and hard to tear up.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

product_meta.title: Kuranda Dog Bed - Chewproof Design - Walnut PVC - Indoor - Elevated - High Strength PVC - Provides Traction - Orthopedic - Best for Allergies/Sensitive Skin - Cordura Fabric
product_meta.description: Size:LRG 40x25| Color:SmokeTired of replacing your dog's bedding only to find it destroyed again and again? Give your dog a lift with the orthopedic support and comfort of a patented Kuranda chewproof dog bed. Our furniture grade poly resin dog bed looks beautiful in any home, yet it's durable design stands up to the most mischievous dogs. The walnut colored frame, legs and corners blend perfectly with our wide choice of fabric colors. The UV resistant finish on our frame is guaranteed to stand up to repeated cleaning. Unlike other dog beds, the patented design of the Kuranda Bed allows the fabric to slide inside the frame which hides the edges of the fabric to discourage chewing. The Cordura fabric is abrasion resistant, is as durable as canvas, and it provides plenty of traction getting on and off the bed. Its great for indoor use. All Fasteners are Stainless Steel. Kuranda Dog Bed's durability has been proven in the most active shelters and kennels worldwide for over 10 years. Each bed is covered by the Kuranda 1 year warranty (See full warranty policy below). SIZE NOTE: Bed measurements on the Product Name are the outter dimensions, see product bullet points for actual fabric area. WEIGHT LIMIT NOTE: For PVC bed our weight limit recommendation is 100lbs, regardless of size. For heavier dogs or more aggressive "chewers" try the Kuranda All-Aluminum or Bronze Aluminum Dog Bed. PLEASE NOTE, WALNUT BED IS FOR INDOOR USE: The walnut frames are not recommended for outdoor use, especially in direct sunlight or locations with high outdoor temps. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: HIGH STRENGTH PVC frame supports up to 100 lbs. For heavier dogs, try the Kuranda All Aluminum Dog Bed or Midnight Black Aluminum Dog Bed.
Elevated/Raised orthopedic design to keep your dog dry, cool, and comfortable.
Easy to Clean, guaranteed to stand up to repeated cleaning.
Cordura is abrasion resistant, is as durable as canvas, and it provides plenty of traction getting on and off the bed. Its great for indoor use.
1 YEAR WARRANTY / Outside Dimensions: 40x25x7 / Fabric Area: 36x22 / Does Not Come Assembled

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
